page.title: 04Domestic Shops in Thornton
page.content: {Trade.}There is now only 1 small supermarket which employs 5 people and is about 2000 sq.ft in size. Mr Walker has owned it for 31 years. {Customers.}Because this is a village he knows most of his customers, many of whom shop daily.Trade increases in the Summer when tourists come. {Products.}These include bacon, butter cereals, soap, ice-cream,confectionery and wine but no hardware. Most successful sales are of peas and peaches and salad ingredients in Summer. {Changes.}In 1984 a large supermarket opened in Pickering.This has seriously damaged trade for the smaller shops and has already led to the closure of the village Co-Operative store.
